required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Color Stability of E.Max CAD Laminate Veneers Cemented With Light Cure Versus Dual Cure Amine Free Adhesive Resin Cement

brief_summary.textblock:
Light curing cements used for laminate veneers may be not totally cured in certain areas, so dual cured resin cements may solve this problem yet the dual cured cements containing amines cause yellowish discoloration of the veneers after time.
A new dual cured cement which is amine free is introduced so the investigators have to try it clinically using parallel groups in randomized clinical trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Color stability assessed clinically using easy shade vita device

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction assessed using a Questionnaire

arm_group.arm_group_label: dual cure amine free adhesive resin cement
arm_group.description: resin cement that get activated by both light and chemicals
resin cement that only get activated by light

intervention.intervention_name: E.Max CAD Laminate Veneers cemented with dual cure amine free adhesive resin cement
intervention.arm_group_label: dual cure amine free adhesive resin cement

intervention.intervention_name: E.Max CAD Laminate Veneers cemented with light cured adhesive resin cement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All subjects are required to be:
- From 18-60 years old, and able to read and sign the informed consent document
- physically and psychologically able to tolerate conventional restorative procedures
- Have no active periodontal or pulpal diseases, have teeth with good restorations
- Patients with teeth problems indicated for laminate veneer (e.g. discoloration, fracture not involve more than 50% enamel loss, mild malposition, ….)
- Willing to return for follow-up examinations and evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients in the growth stage with partially erupted teeth
- Patient with fractured teeth of more than 50% enamel loss
- Patients with poor oral hygiene and motivation
- Pregnant women
- Psychiatric problems or unrealistic expectations
- Lack of opposite occluding dentition in the area intended for restoration

reference.citation: Magalhães AP, Cardoso Pde C, de Souza JB, Fonseca RB, Pires-de-Souza Fde C, Lopez LG. Influence of activation mode of resin cement on the shade of porcelain veneers. J Prosthodont. 2014 Jun;23(4):291-5. doi: 10.1111/jopr.12098. Epub 2013 Oct 7.

Gresnigt MM, Kalk W, Özcan M. Clinical longevity of ceramic laminate veneers bonded to teeth with and without existing composite restorations up to 40 months. Clin Oral Investig. 2013 Apr;17(3):823-32. doi: 10.1007/s00784-012-0790-5. Epub 2012 Jul 21.

responsible_party.investigator_title: dentist at egyption ministry of health
